title: How to Apply Egyptian Eye Makeup

steps.title: Draw your desired eyebrow shape.
steps.content: Draw your desired eyebrow shape. Use an eyebrow with a small strokes, rather than drawing in a full stroke. It gives you a more natural and full look.

steps.title: Brush your eyebrow with an eyebrow brush to blend the color with your natural eyebrows.
steps.content: Brush your eyebrow with an eyebrow brush to blend the color with your natural eyebrows.

steps.title: Clean off the sides of your eyebrows with concealer.
steps.content: Clean off the sides of your eyebrows with concealer. Put concealer on the top and bottom of your eyebrow and blend it with concealer brush to give it a clean look.

steps.title: Set your desired eyebrow shape with the eyebrow gel.
steps.content: Set your desired eyebrow shape with the eyebrow gel.

steps.title: Prime the eyelids so the eyeshadow color can pop.
steps.content: Prime the eyelids so the eyeshadow color can pop. Put concealer on top of it.

steps.title: Take a small piece of tape and line the side of your eyes with an angled shape, up to the end of your eyebrow.
steps.content: Take a small piece of tape and line the side of your eyes with an angled shape, up to the end of your eyebrow. This will give you clean and sharp eye shadow line.

steps.title: Take gel eyeliner and make a “V” shape on the middle of the eyelid.
steps.content: Take gel eyeliner and make a “V” shape on the middle of the eyelid. Start at the top of your eyeball and go to end of the eyelid.

steps.title: Blend that line with navy blue eye shadow.
steps.content: Blend that line with navy blue eye shadow. Use smudge brush to blend the black eyeliner and blue eyeshadow together. You can apply your own choice of eye shadow.

steps.title: Apply the color you want to put on the middle of the eyelid.
steps.content: Apply the color you want to put on the middle of the eyelid. Blend it with the previous shadow with medium eyeshadow brush. Blend both eye shadows with large eye shadow brush so there is no sharp line and it gives a more smokey effect to your eyes.

steps.title: Get a glitter shadow and gently apply it to the first half of the eyelid, near to the tear duct.
steps.content: Get a glitter shadow and gently apply it to the first half of the eyelid, near to the tear duct. This will make your eyes look more awake and give your shadow a dimensional look.

steps.title: Draw a winged line with your gel or liquid eyeliner.
steps.content: Draw a winged line with your gel or liquid eyeliner. Make the end a little longer, which will make your eyes look bold.

steps.title: Take the tape off and draw a line on bottom water line with nude pencil.
steps.content: Take the tape off and draw a line on bottom water line with nude pencil. End the water line with black eyeliner. Don't connect it with top eyeliner but run parallel to that top eyeliner line, leaving a little space in between both lines.

steps.title: Grab your glitter eyeliner and draw a line in the middle of both top and bottom eye liner.
steps.content: Grab your glitter eyeliner and draw a line in the middle of both top and bottom eye liner.

steps.title: Curl your lashes with lash curler.
steps.content: Curl your lashes with lash curler. Give it 2 or 3 presses.

steps.title: Get your false eyelashes.
steps.content: Get your false eyelashes. You can chose between thick or natural shape. Glue them with your eye lash. This step is optional, only if you want to get the bold look.

steps.title: Apply a coat of mascara to blend them with natural lashes.
steps.content: Apply a coat of mascara to blend them with natural lashes.

steps.title: Clean up your side of eye if you have any smudges.
steps.content: Clean up your side of eye if you have any smudges. You are all done!
